snippet: The French Defense Ministry said a raid led by 12 French aircraft had destroyed two Islamic State targets in Raqqa, the group’s self-proclaimed capital.
abstract: French military bombs Raqqa, Syria, destroying at least two Islamic State targets in militant group's self-proclaimed capital; aggressive air raid, coordinated with American forces, comes in retaliation for string of attacks across Paris that killed 129 people.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Paris, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The French Defense Ministry said a raid led by 12 French aircraft had destroyed two Islamic State targets in Raqqa, the group’s self-proclaimed capital.

headline.main: France Strikes ISIS Targets in Syria in Retaliation for Attacks
headline.print_headline: France Strikes ISIS Targets in Syria in Retaliation for Attacks on Paris

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
